instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.ISL5259: What is ISL5259? This is a typo of ISL6259.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, works on battery after isoprophyl cleaning display connector
threads.message:
As title says I was having screen flickering issues so sprayed isoprophyl on the display connector, now theres no green light. Laptop works fine from battery power

I already went through a schematic and found <RESISTOR>R5311</RESISTOR> to be only 67k but seems suspect as if the schematic is wrong(going to order. What should I be looking at next?

UPDATE: [B]photos added and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> gets very hot its a bit small for me to resolder, any other causes for this? [/B]Forgot to mention I have a CMIzapper gpukilller fitted for sometime working fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, works on battery after isoprophyl cleaning display connector
threads.message:
Remove battery and test the board alone on the desk (only charger).
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, with correct values?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, works on battery after isoprophyl cleaning display connector
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 58874"]Remove battery and test the board alone on the desk (only charger).
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, with correct values?[/QUOTE]

Can't say on that I just found a short on <CAPACITOR>C7000</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7001</CAPACITOR> after removing both caps(and losing one) the pads are shorted to ground.
Also <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> measuring 43.2ohms not the spec 2.2ohms.

[B]Update saying that <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> all showing 43.2ohms[/B]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, works on battery after isoprophyl cleaning display connector
threads.message:
Sorry, I didn't see you've open the thread as new user.
Welcome to the forum!

Dead <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, change it.
Also replace all damaged resistors with correct values.

Do NOT quote an entire post visible few centimeters above.
Please maintain forum aesthetic...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, works on battery after isoprophyl cleaning display connector
threads.message:
I didnt notice you were admin either, thanks took a while to activate ended up scrapping that last board.
Is there nothing else that can cause <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> to heat up like that? I dont think I'm capable of getting that soldered back properly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, works on battery after isoprophyl cleaning display connector
threads.message:
You must check diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and all big coils.
It is only theory now, if you cannot replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
As no caps remain on pins 19/20, <CHIP>ISL5259</CHIP> is the only reason to have short there...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, works on battery after isoprophyl cleaning display connector
threads.message: Ok I replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> I get greenlight now but no charging and no red light. Power off battery still works and OSX says battery not charging but coconut battery shows charging at 19.12 watts(its not charging).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, works on battery after isoprophyl cleaning display connector
threads.message:
Mac is powering on with the correct 85w charger obviously hadn't checked the model when I was busy doing a <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> for first time :(
Ok got another 2011 macbook with a faulty GPU but working charge circuit and took some multimeter readings of <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> and getting 45 ohms between pins 1-3 and 4 compared to infinite resistance on the bad charge circuit. <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> has probably worn with it at same time according to what I've read.  
<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> are measuring at 15.5 ohms and 0.5 as oppose to 2.2 and 0 so ordered replacements. 
I've had to order <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> (K0332) and <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> (K0305) from china Aliexpress as couldnt find a UK source so likely going to be June/July when I install these.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, works on battery after isoprophyl cleaning display connector
threads.message:
Ok changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> and both getting super hot. 
Source links here cpc, rs online and other electronic suppliers dont seem to sell them in the UK i could only find ebay for single components in france with expensive post
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.aliexpress.com/item/10piece-100-New-RJK0332-K0332-TO252-4-Chipset/32857742015.html?spm=a2g0s.9042311.0.0.230d4c4d7tuqtY[/URL]
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.aliexpress.com/item/10piece-100-New-RJK0305DPB-RJK0305-K0305-TO-252-Chipset/32868135991.html?spm=a2g0s.9042311.0.0.230d4c4d7tuqtY[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, works on battery after isoprophyl cleaning display connector
threads.message:
I don't suspect the MOSFETs.
Check for knocked off, or moved components.
Be sure to have good solders and check all traces.
Pay atention to <CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR>.
Post basic voltages of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
